intro: Oedibasis platycarpa, commonly known as the broad-fruited grasshopper plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico, where it typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant is characterized by its succulent, branching stems and small, clustered leaves. Its flowers are unisexual, with separate male and female flowers on the same plant, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. Oedibasis platycarpa is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
